meanings.definition: A tuft of strong filaments by which certain bivalve mollusks attach themselves to rocks or other objects.
meanings.sent1: The byssuses of the mussels help them stick to the rocks in the ocean.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the byssuses to understand how mussels anchor themselves.
meanings.sent3: The mussels had a race to see whose byssuses could hold on the longest.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like the byssuses of the mussels, firmly gripping onto her goals.
meanings.sent5: The byssuses of the mussels are like tiny ropes keeping them secure in the water.

meanings.definition: The byssus of certain mollusks, especially the sea mussel, used in making fabrics and other products.
meanings.sent1: The soft fabric was made from the delicate byssuses of the sea mussels.
meanings.sent2: Fashion designers use the byssuses of mollusks to create unique textiles.
meanings.sent3: She sewed a beautiful dress using the shimmering byssuses as embellishments.
meanings.sent4: The byssuses woven into the fabric added a touch of elegance to the design.
meanings.sent5: The byssuses transformed into a luxurious material fit for royalty.
